text:
It looks like when mod_authnz_ldap finds referers in a search results, it tries
to connect to this referers but don't bind to it using the bindDN and
bindPassword specified. Reading the code of the module this don't seem to be a
problem of the module in itself but of apr-util.
I haven't also find a way to make the module not follow referers

I've finally found that if I do the search on the port 3268 of the AD server it
works because it does the search on the global server.
See this for more information:
http://www.microsoft.com/technet/prodtechnol/windows2000serv/reskit/distrib/dsbc_nar_gzoq.mspx?mfr=true
Doing searches on this port I don't have the referrals anymore so it works well

creator: minfrin@sharp.fm
text:
As this issue has a workaround (using the AD global catalog and in the process
avoiding referrals), I am closing it - please reopen if this is still a problem.

There is also a free MS app called ADAM, active directory application mode,
which is designed to front-end AD to serve traditional LDAP clients.
